description: Describes the specified listeners or the listeners for the specified Application Load Balancer, Network Load Balancer, or Gateway Load Balancer. You must specify either a load balancer or one or more listeners.

parameters.name: ListenerArns
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the listeners. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Listeners
nested_items.description: Information about the listeners.

nested_items.name: ListenerArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port on which the load balancer is listening.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol for connections from clients to the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Certificates
nested_items.description: [HTTPS or TLS listener] The default certificate for the listener.

nested_items.name: CertificateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.

nested_items.name: IsDefault
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the certificate is the default certificate. Do not set this value when specifying a certificate as an input. This value is not included in the output when describing a listener, but is included when describing listener certificates.

nested_items.name: SslPolicy
nested_items.description: [HTTPS or TLS listener] The security policy that defines which protocols and ciphers are supported.

nested_items.name: DefaultActions
nested_items.description: The default actions for the listener.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of action.

nested_items.name: TargetGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group. Specify only when Type is forward and you want to route to a single target group. To route to one or more target groups, use ForwardConfig instead.

nested_items.name: AuthenticateOidcConfig
nested_items.description: [HTTPS listeners] Information about an identity provider that is compliant with OpenID Connect (OIDC). Specify only when Type is authenticate-oidc.

nested_items.name: Issuer
nested_items.description: The OIDC issuer identifier of the IdP. This must be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol, the domain, and the path.

nested_items.name: AuthorizationEndpoint
nested_items.description: The authorization endpoint of the IdP. This must be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol, the domain, and the path.

nested_items.name: TokenEndpoint
nested_items.description: The token endpoint of the IdP. This must be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol, the domain, and the path.

nested_items.name: UserInfoEndpoint
nested_items.description: The user info endpoint of the IdP. This must be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol, the domain, and the path.

nested_items.name: ClientId
nested_items.description: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier.

nested_items.name: ClientSecret
nested_items.description: The OAuth 2.0 client secret. This parameter is required if you are creating a rule. If you are modifying a rule, you can omit this parameter if you set UseExistingClientSecret to true.

nested_items.name: SessionCookieName
nested_items.description: The name of the cookie used to maintain session information. The default is AWSELBAuthSessionCookie.

nested_items.name: Scope
nested_items.description: The set of user claims to be requested from the IdP. The default is openid.

nested_items.name: SessionTimeout
nested_items.description: The maximum duration of the authentication session, in seconds. The default is 604800 seconds (7 days).

nested_items.name: AuthenticationRequestExtraParams
nested_items.description: The query parameters (up to 10) to include in the redirect request to the authorization endpoint.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OnUnauthenticatedRequest
nested_items.description: The behavior if the user is not authenticated. The following are possible values:
deny  - Return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized error.
allow  - Allow the request to be forwarded to the target.
authenticate  - Redirect the request to the IdP authorization endpoint. This is the default value.

nested_items.name: UseExistingClientSecret
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to use the existing client secret when modifying a rule. If you are creating a rule, you can omit this parameter or set it to false.

nested_items.name: AuthenticateCognitoConfig
nested_items.description: [HTTPS listeners] Information for using Amazon Cognito to authenticate users. Specify only when Type is authenticate-cognito.

nested_items.name: UserPoolArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Cognito user pool.

nested_items.name: UserPoolClientId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Cognito user pool client.

nested_items.name: UserPoolDomain
nested_items.description: The domain prefix or fully-qualified domain name of the Amazon Cognito user pool.

nested_items.name: SessionCookieName
nested_items.description: The name of the cookie used to maintain session information. The default is AWSELBAuthSessionCookie.

nested_items.name: Scope
nested_items.description: The set of user claims to be requested from the IdP. The default is openid.

nested_items.name: SessionTimeout
nested_items.description: The maximum duration of the authentication session, in seconds. The default is 604800 seconds (7 days).

nested_items.name: AuthenticationRequestExtraParams
nested_items.description: The query parameters (up to 10) to include in the redirect request to the authorization endpoint.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OnUnauthenticatedRequest
nested_items.description: The behavior if the user is not authenticated. The following are possible values:
deny  - Return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized error.
allow  - Allow the request to be forwarded to the target.
authenticate  - Redirect the request to the IdP authorization endpoint. This is the default value.

nested_items.name: Order
nested_items.description: The order for the action. This value is required for rules with multiple actions. The action with the lowest value for order is performed first.

nested_items.name: RedirectConfig
nested_items.description: [Application Load Balancer] Information for creating a redirect action. Specify only when Type is redirect.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol. You can specify HTTP, HTTPS, or #{protocol}. You can redirect HTTP to HTTP, HTTP to HTTPS, and HTTPS to HTTPS. You can't redirect HTTPS to HTTP.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port. You can specify a value from 1 to 65535 or #{port}.

nested_items.name: Host
nested_items.description: The hostname. This component is not percent-encoded. The hostname can contain #{host}.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The absolute path, starting with the leading '/'. This component is not percent-encoded. The path can contain #{host}, #{path}, and #{port}.

nested_items.name: Query
nested_items.description: The query parameters, URL-encoded when necessary, but not percent-encoded. Do not include the leading '?', as it is automatically added. You can specify any of the reserved keywords.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: The HTTP redirect code. The redirect is either permanent (HTTP 301) or temporary (HTTP 302).

nested_items.name: FixedResponseConfig
nested_items.description: [Application Load Balancer] Information for creating an action that returns a custom HTTP response. Specify only when Type is fixed-response.

nested_items.name: MessageBody
nested_items.description: The message.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: The HTTP response code (2XX, 4XX, or 5XX).

nested_items.name: ContentType
nested_items.description: The content type.

nested_items.name: ForwardConfig
nested_items.description: Information for creating an action that distributes requests among one or more target groups. For Network Load Balancers, you can specify a single target group. Specify only when Type is forward. If you specify both ForwardConfig and TargetGroupArn, you can specify only one target group using ForwardConfig and it must be the same target group specified in TargetGroupArn.

nested_items.name: TargetGroups
nested_items.description: The target groups. For Network Load Balancers, you can specify a single target group.

nested_items.name: TargetGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group.

nested_items.name: Weight
nested_items.description: The weight. The range is 0 to 999.

nested_items.name: TargetGroupStickinessConfig
nested_items.description: The target group stickiness for the rule.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether target group stickiness is enabled.

nested_items.name: DurationSeconds
nested_items.description: The time period, in seconds, during which requests from a client should be routed to the same target group. The range is 1-604800 seconds (7 days).

nested_items.name: AlpnPolicy
nested_items.description: [TLS listener] The name of the Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation (ALPN) policy.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MutualAuthentication
nested_items.description: The mutual authentication configuration information.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The client certificate handling method. Options are off, passthrough or verify. The default value is off.

nested_items.name: TrustStoreArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the trust store.

nested_items.name: IgnoreClientCertificateExpiry
nested_items.description: Indicates whether expired client certificates are ignored.

nested_items.name: TrustStoreAssociationStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates a shared trust stores association status.

nested_items.name: AdvertiseTrustStoreCaNames
nested_items.description: Indicates whether trust store CA certificate names are advertised.

nested_items.name: NextMarker
nested_items.description: If there are additional results, this is the marker for the next set of results. Otherwise, this is null.
